cards.name: Robert Baratheon
cards.text: Renown. Reaction: After the standing phase begins (choose one): - other characters with printed cost 5 or higher cannot stand this phase. - characters with printed cost 4 or lower cannot stand this phase. - locations cannot stand this phase.

cards.name: Stannis Baratheon
cards.text: Immune to opponents' events. Reaction: After you win a [power] challenge, draw X cards. X is the claim value on the attacking player's revealed plot card.
cards.flavor: "I never asked for this crown."

cards.name: Melisandre
cards.text: Stealth. Reaction: After you win an [intrigue] challenge in which Melisandre is attacking, move 1 power from a character controlled by the losing opponent to Melisandre. Then, if that character has no power, kill it.

cards.name: Renly Baratheon
cards.text: Renown. Action: Kneel your faction card to put a non-[baratheon] character with printed cost X or lower into play from your hand. X is Renly Baratheon's STR.
cards.flavor: "Tyrell swords will make me king."

cards.name: Salladhor Saan
cards.text: Reaction: After you marshal a Smuggler character, choose and kneel a location. Then, gain gold equal to that location's printed cost. (Limit once per round.)
cards.flavor: "Good ser, it is gold I crave, not words on papers."

cards.name: Ser Davos Seaworth
cards.text: Stealth. Reaction: After you win a challenge in which Ser Davos Seaworth is participating, discard 1 power from the losing opponent's faction card. Then, you may have a King character you control gain 1 power.

cards.name: Alester Florent
cards.text: Reaction: After a House Florent character enters play, draw a card. (Limit once per round.) Interrupt: When Alester Florent leaves play, if you control another R'hllor character, choose and kneel a character an opponent controls.
cards.flavor: "Stannis Baratheon will never sit the Iron Throne. Is it treason to say the truth? A bitter truth, but no less true for that."

cards.name: Selyse Baratheon
cards.text: Reduce the cost of each R'hllor attachment you marshal by 3.
cards.flavor: "A queen should be a mistress beneath her own roof."

cards.name: Griffin's Roost Knight
cards.text: Interrupt: When the challenges phase ends, if you have not lost a [power] challenge this phase, stand Griffin's Roost Knight.
cards.flavor: Griffin's Roost was strong but small...

cards.name: Dale Seaworth
cards.text: Reaction: After you marshal Dale Seaworth, choose a [baratheon] location in your discard pile and return it to your hand.
cards.flavor: "Your son Dale will go south in Wraith, past Cape Wrath and the Broken Arm, all along the coast of Dorne as far as the Arbor." <cite>Stannis Baratheon</cite>

cards.name: Ser Imry Florent
cards.text: Action: Kill Ser Imry Florent to choose an opponent. You may sacrifice any number of locations. For each location sacrificed this way, that opponent must choose and kneel a standing character he or she controls.
cards.flavor: With four times as many ships as the boy king, Ser Imry saw no need for caution or deceptive tactics.

cards.name: Red Priest
cards.text: Reaction: After Red Priest enters play, look at an opponent's hand. Then, choose 1 card in that hand and remove it from the game until Red Priest leaves play.
cards.flavor: The red priest lit their fires every day at sunset, to thank R'hllor for the day just ending, and beg him to send his sun back on the morrow to banish the gathering darkness.

cards.name: Shyra Errol
cards.text: Interrupt: When a character is killed, sacrifice Shyra Errol to move each power from that character to its controller's faction card.

cards.name: Acolyte of the Flame
cards.text: Reaction: After the draw phase begins, kneel Acolyte of the Flame to look at the top 2 cards of an opponent's deck. You may put those cards on the bottom of that player's deck.
cards.flavor: "Any cat may stare into a fire and see red mice at play." <cite>Melisandre</cite>

cards.name: Bastard of Robert
cards.text: While you control Robert Baratheon, reduce the cost to marshal Bastard of Robert by 2. Reaction: After Bastard of Robert enters play, if you control a King character, draw a card.
cards.flavor: "If you bed enough women, some will give you presents, and His Grace has never been shy on that count." <cite>Littlefinger</cite>

cards.name: Wily Smuggler
cards.text: Action: Choose 1 card from your hand and place it on top of your deck. Then, at the end of the phase, draw 1 card. (Limit once per round.)
cards.flavor: A smuggler had best know men as well as tides, or he would not live to smuggle long.

cards.name: The Stormlands
cards.text: You may initiate an additional [power] challenge during the challenges phase. Reaction: After you win a [power] challenge, kneel The Stormlands to choose and stand a participating King or Queen character.

cards.name: Cape Wrath
cards.text: During [power] challenges in which you are the attacking or defending player, raise the claim value on the attacking player's revealed plot card by 1.
cards.flavor: ...he would never have dared attempt a landing on Cape Wrath; the storm lords were too fiercely loyal to House Baratheon and to King Robert.

cards.name: Lyseni Galley
cards.text: Action: Kneel Lyseni Galley to choose a character. Until the end of the phase, that character gets +1 STR. If that character is a Captain or Smuggler, it gains stealth until the end of the phase.
cards.flavor: One of Salladhor Saan's warships was sweeping past the castle, her gaily striped hull slicing through the greygreen waters as her oars rose and fell.

cards.name: Azor Ahai Reborn
cards.text: Unique character you control only. Terminal. Attached character is considered to be participating in each challenge in which you control an attacking R'hllor character.

cards.name: Hunting Accident
cards.text:
Ambush (3). Terminal.
Attached character cannot stand.
cards.flavor: "He slew the boar. His entrails were sliding from his belly, yet somehow he slew the boar." <cite>Renly Baratheon</cite>

cards.name: Warhammer
cards.text:
If attached character's printed STR is 4 or lower, it gets +2 STR.
If attached character's printed STR is 5 or higher, it gains intimidate.
cards.flavor: He'd had a giant's strength too, his weapon of choice a spiked iron warhammer that Ned could scarcely lift.

cards.name: "A Cask of Ale"
cards.text: Reaction: After you win a [power] challenge, choose 2 cards controlled by the same player. Move up to 2 power from one of those cards to the other.

cards.name: Nightfire Visions
cards.text: Play only if you control a R'hllor character. Taxation Action: Name a Trait. If an opponent reveals a plot card with that Trait during the next plot phase, draw 3 cards.

cards.name: Botley Crew
cards.text: Reaction: After an opponent collects income, return 1 gold from that player's gold pool to the treasury.

cards.name: Every Captain is a King
cards.text: Action: Until the end of the phase, each Captain character you control gains the King trait and does not kneel when declared as an attacker in [power] challenges.
cards.flavor: ...it was small wonder they named the islands the land of ten thousand kings.

cards.name: Ser Gregor Clegane
cards.text: Intimidate. Pillage. Forced Reaction: After you win a challenge in which Ser Gregor Clegane is participating, choose and kill a character you control.
cards.flavor: "Gregor is a very large man. Also a very stupid one. Too stupid to know when he should die, it seems." <cite>Cersei Lannister</cite>

cards.name: Lionstar
cards.text: Action: Kneel Lionstar to put a [lannister] character with printed cost 4 or lower into play from your hand. At the end of the phase, if that card is still in play, discard it from play.
cards.flavor: Her hull was black and gold, her figurehead a lion with an upraised paw.

cards.name: Prince's Attendant
cards.text: Marshaling Action: Kneel Prince's Attendant to reduce the cost of the next [martell] Lord or Lady character you marshal this phase by 2.

cards.name: Kingsgrave
cards.text: Reaction: After you lose a [power] challenge by 5 or more STR, kneel and sacrifice Kingsgrave to choose a participating character and return it to its owner's hand. (You may kill that character instead if it has the King trait.)

errata.text: Reaction: After you lose a [power] challenge by 5 or more STR, kneel and sacrifice Kingsgrave to choose a participating character and return it to its owner's hand. (You may kill that character instead if it has the King trait.)

Reaction: After you lose a [power] challenge by 5 or more STR, kneel and sacrifice Kingsgrave to choose a participating character and return it to its owner's hand. (You may kill that character instead if it has the King trait.)
errata.notes: Card text is improperly formatted; the word "Kingsgrave" should not be formatted as a trait.

cards.name: Protectors of the Realm
cards.text:
No attachments.
X is your reserve value.
cards.flavor: "Oh, eight thousand years is a good while, to be sure... yet if the Night's Watch does not remember, who will?" <cite>Old Bear Mormont</cite>

cards.name: The Horn that Wakes the Sleepers
cards.text: Reaction: After an opponent initiates a challenge against you, choose and stand a Builder character, a Ranger character, and a Steward character.
cards.flavor: "They never blow three. Not for hundreds and thousands of years. Three means —" <cite>Samwell Tarly</cite>

cards.name: She-Bear
cards.text: Reaction: After you marshal She-Bear, you may put a [stark] character or attachment with printed cost 3 or lower into play from your hand.
cards.flavor: "You are braver than I am, I fear. Are all your Bear Island women such warriors?" <cite>Catelyn Stark</cite>

cards.name: Bearskin Cloak
cards.text: Attached character gets +1 STR. If attached character has the House Mormont trait, it gains stealth.
cards.flavor: "A woman in a bearskin, with a child in one arm suckling her breast. In the other hand she holds a battleaxe. She's no proper lady, that one, but I always loved her." <cite>Dacey Mormont</cite>

cards.name: Haggo
cards.text: Reaction: After you win a challenge in which Haggo is participating, discard a card from your hand to choose a Dothraki card in your discard pile and return it to your hand.
cards.flavor: ...Haggo, huge and silent, often glowered...

cards.name: Dothraki Steed
cards.text: Limit 1 copy per character. While attached character is attacking, it gets +1 STR (+3 STR instead if it has the Dothraki trait).

errata.text: While attached character is attacking, it gets +1 STR (+3 STR instead if it has the Dothraki trait).
Limit 1 copy per character. While attached character is attacking, it gets +1 STR (+3 STR instead if it has the Dothraki trait).

cards.name: Hightower Knight
cards.text: Action: Kneel a non-[tyrell] Knight character to put Hightower Knight into play from your hand.

cards.name: Fields of the Reach
cards.text: Reaction: After you win a [power] challenge, kneel 3 The Reach locations to raise the claim value on your revealed plot card by 1 until the end of the challenge.
cards.flavor: "In Highgarden there are fields of golden roses that stretch away as far as the eye can see." <cite>Robert Baratheon</cite>

cards.name: Lyn Corbray
cards.text: Stealth. Reaction: After an opponent initiates a [power] challenge against you, stand Lyn Corbray.
cards.flavor: "I have never taken kindly to chastisement, as any number of dead men could tell you."

cards.name: Unlikely Champion
cards.text: While you control a Lord or Lady character, Unlikely Champion gains a [power] icon.
cards.flavor: Near forty men took part, freeriders and hedge knights and new-made squires in search of a reputation.

cards.name: Anguy the Archer
cards.text: While you control no loyal characters, Anguy the Archer does not kneel when declared as an attacker or defender in a [military] challenge.
cards.flavor: That afternoon a boy named Anguy, an unheralded commoner from the Dornish Marches, won the archery competition, outshooting Ser Balon Swann and Jalabhar Xho at a hundred paces...

cards.name: The Hollow Hill
cards.text: Dominance Action: If you control no loyal characters, kneel The Hollow Hill to search the top 10 cards of your deck for a non-loyal character, reveal it, and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
cards.flavor: "A refuge where neither wolves nor lions come prowling." <cite>Lem Lemoncloak</cite>

cards.name: Lady Forlorn
cards.text:
Attached character gets +1 STR for each neutral location you control.
If attached character is Lyn Corbray, he gains a [power] icon.
cards.flavor: "My lady has a thirst. Whenever she comes out to dance, she likes a drop of red." <cite>Lyn Corbray</cite>

cards.name: Defiance
cards.text: Challenges Action: Choose and stand a character that has not participated in a challenge this phase. (Max 1 per phase.)
cards.flavor: "I thank you, my lords... but I spit upon your pity." <cite>Ser Barristan Selmy</cite>

cards.name: The Prince that was Promised
cards.text: After all agendas are announced, name a unique character. Other characters you control cannot gain power. Reaction: After you win a [power] challenge by 5 or more STR, kneel your faction card to, either: stand the named character and draw a card; or, search your deck, discard pile, and dead pile for the named character, reveal it, add it to your hand, and shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Parley at Storm's End
cards.text: When Revealed: Name a challenge type. Until you reveal a new plot card, challenges of that type cannot be initiated.

cards.name: Outwit
cards.text: Interrupt: When the effects of a when revealed ability would initiate, kneel your faction card and a unique Maester character to cancel those effects.

cards.name: Siege Preparations
cards.text: Dominance Action: Draw cards until your hand size is equal to your reserve value. (Limit once per phase.)

cards.name: Rationing
cards.text: Players cannot trigger reactions to winning or losing challenges.

cards.name: Desperate Attack
cards.text: While you are the defending player, raise the claim value on the attacking player's revealed plot card by 1.

cards.name: The Hand's Tourney
cards.text: Forced Interrupt: When claim is applied for a [military] challenge, apply [power] claim instead.

cards.name: The New Gods
cards.text: Each The Seven character you control does not kneel when declared as an attacker in the first challenge you initiate during the challenges phase.
